Description: Lip, wall and handle-root fragment of East Greek (Milesian?) pottery cup; interior glazed, with red stripe; exterior: top of lip and lower wall glazed, handle zone reserved with trace of decoration preserved top left; inscription cut inside, probably facing out.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Höckmann & Möller 2006 no. 8. Edgar incorrectly identifies the sherd as Chian.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (pl. IV, no. 16)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 696, no. 538)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.845)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
